definition: agriculture considered as an occupation or way of life, bring into a different state
details:
noun
- agriculture considered as an occupation or way of life
= synonyms: farming
- the people who live in a nation or country
= synonyms: nation, country
- a politically organized body of people under a single government
= synonyms: state
- the territory occupied by a nation
= example: the territory occupied by a nation
= synonyms: state
- territory over which rule or control is exercised
= synonyms: domain, demesne
- the solid part of the earth's surface
= example: the solid part of the earth's surface
= synonyms: ground, earth, dry land, solid ground, terra firma
- material in the top layer of the surface of the earth in which plants can grow (especially with reference to its quality or use)
= example: material in the top layer of the surface of the earth in which plants can grow (especially with reference to its quality or use)
= synonyms: ground, soil
- extensive landed property (especially in the country) retained by the owner for his own use
= example: extensive landed property (especially in the country) retained by the owner for his own use
= synonyms: estate, demesne, landed estate, acres
- the land on which real estate is located
= example: the land on which real estate is located
- a domain in which something is dominant
= synonyms: realm, kingdom
verb
- bring into a different state
= example: bring into a different state
- reach or come to rest
= example: reach or come to rest
= synonyms: set down
- cause to come to the ground
= example: cause to come to the ground
= synonyms: bring down
- shoot at and force to come down
= example: shoot at and force to come down
= synonyms: down
- arrive on shore
= example: arrive on shore
= synonyms: shore, set ashore
- bring ashore
= example: bring ashore
- to deliver a blow
= example: to deliver a blow
